message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about acoustics. When clapping in an auditorium, the sound waves produced bounce off the walls, floor, and ceiling, creating an echo. Option (A) is incorrect because solar flares are not related to clapping in an auditorium. Option (B) is unrelated and irrelevant. Option (C) describes a human emotion and is not related to the physical phenomenon of an echo.

This question requires some basic knowledge about acoustics and the behavior of sound waves. When you clap in an auditorium, the sound waves created will bounce off the walls and other surfaces, causing an echo. This means you will hear a repeated, fainter sound for a few moments after clapping. Option (A) is incorrect because solar flares are not related to clapping in an auditorium. Option (B) is irrelevant and unrelated to the question. Option (C) is incorrect because "indignant" refers to a feeling of anger or annoyance and has no connection to clapping or the resulting sound.

Option (A) is incorrect because solar flares are not related to clapping in an auditorium. Option (B) is unrelated and irrelevant.
